1.text: Place your candle in the fridge or freezer to harden the wax.

2.text: Mix table salt into the wax to slow down the melting rate.

3.text: Trim the candle wick to help ensure a longer burn time.

4.text: Recenter the wick if it moves out of place.

5.text: Avoid placing the candle in a drafty area so it burns evenly.

6.text: Melt the top layer of wax when the candle is first lit to prevent tunneling.

7.text: Burn a candle for no more than 4 hours at a time.

8.text: Allow the candle to cool completely before lighting it again.

9.text: Blow out the candle gently to avoid spraying melted wax.

10.text: Let the candle cool before putting it away.

12.text: Wipe away any burn spots from the candle holder, if necessary.
